intro: Spermacoce exserta, commonly known as the African star-of-Bethlehem, is a flowering plant native to tropical and southern Africa. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant produces small, white to pink flowers that are often clustered in umbels, giving it a star-like appearance. Its fruit is a capsule that splits open to release small, smooth seeds. Spermacoce exserta is often grown as an ornamental plant due to its attractive blooms and relatively low maintenance requirements.
